names.english: normalize the flow of qi and invigorate the blood decoction
names.commonEnglish: Normalize the Flow of Qi and Invigorate the Blood Decoction

actions: Promotes the flow of Qi, harmonizes the Middle Jiao, expands the chest and benefits the diaphragm.
With Xiang Fu, for fullness, distention, and discomfort in the epigastrium and abdomen due to Liver attacking the Spleen.
Invigorates Blood circulation, dispels Blood Stasis, reduces swellings, opens the channels and alleviates pain.
With Hong Hua, for traumatic injury with painful, swollen bruises or hematomas.
Invigorates and harmonizes the Blood.
With Tao Ren and Hong Hua, for symptoms associated with Blood Stasis.
With Xiang Fu, tonifies the Blood and moves Qi.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis and relieves pain.
With Tao Ren, for Blood Stasis.
with Xiang Fu, for flank pain, abdominal pain and dysmenorrhea due to Qi and Blood Stagnation.
Breaks up Blood Stasis and invigorates Blood circulation.

With Hong Hua, invigorates the Blood for all types of Blood Stagnation such as dysmenorrhea, amenorrhea with abdominal pain, clotting and scanty flow, swollen painful sores and chest pain due to Blood Stasis.
With Hong Hua, Dang Gui Wei and Chi Shao, for trauma with pain.
Promotes the movement of Qi, reduces distention and pressure and resolves hardenings
Promotes the movement of Qi in the Middle Jiao and resolves Stagnation.
Spreads and regulates Liver Qi and alleviates pain.
Promotes the movement of Qi and alleviates pain.
Promotes the movement of Qi.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, opens the channels and alleviates pain.
Moves Qi
Eliminates Stagnation
Invigorates the Blood
Breaks up Stasis

symptoms: A history of traumatic injury to the low back and/or hip area
Pain extends from the low back to the thigh, possibly radiating to the lower thigh and lateral leg
Possible palpable cords or hardness in the buttock area
Possible restricted movement of the lower limbs
manifestations.tongue: Possible systemic symptoms of Qi and Blood Stagnation: Irritability Premenstrual breast distention and pain Dysmenorrhea A dark, sooty facial complexion  Dark and purplish with possible maculae or spots C: White P: Wiry and choppy

modifications.purpose: pain which is worse with Cold and better with warmth
